techmeme.title: Israel compromising Hezbollah pagers shows the West should take hardware security more seriously, especially as most electronics manufacturing shifted to Asia (Chris Miller/Financial Times)
Filing: Saudi Arabia's PIF sold ~17.3M Nintendo shares between August 21 to October 1, lowering its stake to 7.54%, despite an exec saying it wants to buy more (Bloomberg)
Dublin-based Appeals Centre, backed by Meta's Oversight Board, launches to moderate disputes between EU users and Facebook, TikTok, and YouTube under the DSA (Supantha Mukherjee/Reuters)
Foxconn Chair Young Liu says the company plans to build a plant in Mexico's Guadalajara to make Nvidia GB200 Blackwell AI servers, as tech decouples from China (Kathrin Hille/Financial Times)
Online gig platforms sought to increase their "take rates" amid slowing growth; PitchBook: Fiverr and Upwork are trading at less than 20% their pandemic peaks (Stephanie Stacey/Financial Times)
